quote-source: The Economist, Oh for a new risorgimento, June 9, 2011.
quote-text: If you know how any place in Italy was governed in the 14th century – as a self-governing commune, as part of the Papal states or by a monarchy in the south – you can predict with reasonable certainty what proportion of people there would come out to vote in a referendum tomorrow or donate blood. That is an awful lot of history to push against.
